column4: i have a usb stick, and the filesystem seems corrupted, so i have to reformat it... problem is gparted can't do it (i get "error" without description), and i can't do it with mkfs either (i get "/dev/sda contains a mounted file system")... what should i do?
you need to do sudo umount /path/to/mount/point
and then try gksudo gparted
you may have to point it to /dev/sda
how do i do that exactly?
i don't know. look for an option to add an fs
i already did mkfs -t msdos /dev/sda
while it was unmounted?
is it the same if i unmount it via gui?
i don't know, i don't usually use gui tools if i can avoid it
that's what i did
after umounting it
is it maybe /dev/sda1? that's what it is on mine (but i don't know)
mkfs.msdos: unable to open /dev/sda1
are you sudoing? sorry, i'm kind of making this up as i go along
i tried with and without sudo
oh...hm. Have you tried the livecd?
you can get it off their site
nope, but that shouldn't change anything, should it?
other than that i haven't the foggiest...sorry
thanks anyway
i don't know. probably not
sorry :-/
